text: I've got to ask, time and time again, just what is the point in Japanese culture which always has some of the best JRPGs ending up with the main character holding dual weapons. From .//hack to Tales of Symphonia to La Pucelle to Suikoden to Grandia... just what is it that makes holding 2 of the same better than both ever could be on their own...?

text: This song brings out an emotion nothing else does for me. Its sad. Nostalgic. Almost hopefull. While being short and sweat. This kind of music is not made any more for tales games. Nothing I've heard from berseria is even close to how wonderful this is. Any good game can be an even better one with a splendid soundtrack, I've felt no passion or soul put into any modern tales games. And that's a shame.

text: i love this music.  I used to have this awesome couch in my gaming room....and sometimes i would just load the game up, get to the desert town, and just take a nap with it on....that was my sleeping couch.  I know it sounds like something old to say, but i was just out of college at the time, and ive never been someone who could take naps....weird memory.

author: Carlos Pozo

text:
I recently finished the game and it was GREAT! The overall story wasn't that important and the drama could be more intense, especially there was enough materials, some were very intense like the Desians, but the mysteries behind the characters, their schemes and all about the world, kept me curious to proceed the story more eagerly.
Kratos Aurion is my favorite character, by far! ^^

I no play the sequel and despite the lack of an overworld, the game is pretty good, especially the combat is much more fun and challenging.
author: RazielOneX

text:
I finished it yesterday. I was reluctant to play it at first cause I've had it with over rated games, but I LOVED it. Kratos is also my favorite character. 
I still think Tales of the Abyss is the best in the series though.

author: Кейти Тамира

text: I seriously doubt that. It's a pretty subjective matter though, so it really comes down to what your tastes are. If you want a positive, upbeat game, go with Graces. If you want a more dark and realistic experience, Abyss is probably your safest bet. All the games have SOMETHING they do better than the others, so it's really hard to say which one is "the best". In my personal opinion it's Symphonia or Abyss, but I can perfectly understand why someone would prefer Vesperia or Graces.

text:

But on closer thought, I think Dawn of the New World is better than Legendia. Plus, now I've trie Tales of Graces F as well, so here is my new list: 

8. Tales of Hearts
7. Tales of Legendia
6. Tales of Symphonia: Dawn of the New World
5. Tales of Phantasia
4. Tales of Vesperia
3. Tales of Graces F
2. Tales of the Abyss
1. Tales of Symphonia

author: TheGrottoMotto

text:
Yeah, any of those would work, really. Even just grass would work if it was of the same style and integrated better...just a little boring. It's just such a hack job, poorly executed. 

Your idea of Tehe'alla and Sylvarant in the background would give the characters an environment that's specific and fits them well. Maybe you should remake the cover, it could only be an improvement,lol!
author: newnature

text: I get it. What's a background that does fit though? Maybe a background of Tehe'alla and Sylvarant in the distance?
author: TheGrottoMotto

text: Yes, the individual drawings are good (I believe they are either conceptual designs or early game promotion) but the designer simply clipped the art out, feathered the edge then dropped them into a PHOTO of grass and used and bland font and generic drop shadow for the title and called it a day. I would say it's lazy but if you were REALLY lazy, you would use the logo on the box (which is not bad) and slap it on some sketches that look artsy and be done, that would look far better than this crap.

text: The first time i played ToS it changed the way I view RPG's forever. Now I've played through it more times than I care to remember, and every time it strikes me what a truly outstanding game it is in all respects: the music, gameplay, characters, story, art style - everything. It has won a place in heart that will never be taken, and has so many amazing soundtracks they could frankly all be in this list. Quite remarkable.
